page.title: 09Banbury Lane
page.content: {BANBURY LANE, NORTHAMPTON TO BANBURY} is the oldest Northamptonshire route, once part of the Jurassic Way. For centuries it was used as a Drove Road, sheep being driven from Wales to Nor- thampton & beyond until the advent of the railways. Much of the Lane was metalled but parts remained earth, in- cluding from Adstone Lodge South to Moreton Pinkney-Weston Road, along which horse & carts plied within living memory. Gradually the 30ft. By-Way open to All became 6ins. wide in places with hedges meeting in the middle. In 1981 the Green Friends of Banbury Lane was formed. By 1983 the two miles were opened up part to the Central Bends cleared radically by a farmer the rest by Youth Action & a Community Enterprise Team. Unfor- tunately some roots were left & the Lane is getting impassable again.
